greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array A(n,k), n >= 0, k >= 2, read by antidiagonals: A(n,k) = [x^(k*n)] Product_{j>=0} 1/(1 - x^(k^j)).
comment: A(n,k) is the number of partitions of k*n into powers of k.
link: George E. Andrews, Aviezri S. Fraenkel, James A. Sellers, Characterizing the number of m-ary partitions modulo m, Amer. Math. Monthly 122:9 (2015), 880-885.
Index entries for related partition-counting sequences
mathematica: Table[Function[k, SeriesCoefficient[Product[1/(1 - x^k^i), {i, 0, n}], {x, 0, k n}]][j - n + 2], {j, 0, 12}, {n, 0, j}] // Flatten
xref: Mirror of A089688 (excluding the first row).
results.author: _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Sep 17 2017
